H0.text: where was the city of david. Hebron

H1.text: where was the city of david. Jericho

H2.text: where was the city of david. Samaria

H3.text: where was the city of david. Bethlehem

A4.text: City of David (archaeological site), the original settlement core of Jerusalem during the Bronze and Iron Ages

A5.text: the part of Jerusalem called the City of David shows first signs of settlement in the 4th millennium BCE, in the shape of encampments of nomadic shepherds

A6.text: the ancient settlement of Jerusalem, founded as early as the Bronze Age on the hill above the Gihon Spring, was, according to the Bible, named Jebus. Called the 'Fortress of Zion' (metsudat Zion), it was renamed as the 'City of David', and was known by this name in antiquity

A7.text: King David called by God to relocate to Hebron and reign from there for some seven years (2 Samuel 2:1â€“3)

A8.text: the city is also recognized in the Bible as the place where David was anointed king of Israel

A11.text: The Hebrew Bible also calls it Beth-Lehem Judah, and the New Testament describes it as the 'City of David'.

A12.text: Archaeological confirmation of Bethlehem as a city in the Kingdom of Judah was uncovered in 2012 at the archaeological dig at the City of David in the form of a bulla used for tax payments in the 8th or 7th century BCE.
